DOC.HEAD: Child Strangled in Ski Accident
DOC.TEXT: A Michigan ski area shut down Tuesday after a 6-year-old boy apparently was strangled in a ski-lift mechanism. Anthony Ryan Mazzali of La Porte, Texas, visiting relatives with his parents, died Saturday at Munising's city-owned Maple Mountain Ski Hill on Michigan's Upper Peninsula, police Chief Douglas Miron said Tuesday. Don Fahrbach, the Alger County medical examiner who handled boy's autopsy, said Anthony apparently died of strangulation after his clothing became caught in the lift machinery. Fahrbach said tests to confirm the cause of death were due back later this week. Miron said it was the first time anyone had been killed or seriously injured at the ski hill. The resort, which is privately managed for the city, had been closed for Christmas and remained closed Tuesday, officials said.
